poem:
In Fritzi's Steps

The red brick whispers  
stories to children,  
cobblestones echo  
each tick of time captured,  
Fritzi's footsteps weave  
through shadows of walls.  
Latchkey dreams,  
Duty-bound histories  
tender as the dusk-lit street;  
in Leipzig, every gate  
opens  
to the ghost of possibility.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘No topic is too difficult’: children’s series on life in communist East Germany wins an Emmy The creators of a children’s television series about life in communist East Germany have said they hope it will awaken interest in the region’s history, after it was awarded an International Emmy. Auf Fritzis Spuren (In Fritzi’s Footsteps) tells the story of a 12-year-old girl living in the eastern city of Leipzig and how she experiences life in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
